website_summaries.verdict: As long as you don't need expert-level features, the 2013 AirPort Time Capsule is an excellent backup/file server for Apple fans -- especially for those with 802.11ac-enabled Macs.
pros: Apple's new supercompact AirPort Time Capsule is aesthetically attractive, supports 802.11ac Wi-Fi, and offers overall fast performance
cons: A Wi-Fi speed boost and a new design are the only real improvements versus the previous model
Not the best option if you're looking for advanced features, household media streaming, and non-Mac options

customer_reviews.title: Apple Time Capsule is the world's best router for home office users
customer_reviews.text: Good for back-ups, great for worry free network traffic across 18 diff devices on 3 diff platforms. No collisions, no one getting bumped off the network, MAC - WIN PC - Android all living together in harmony with a lousy Xfinity gateway and DirecTV plus Appel TV. I used to have issues with my Cisco wireless router 400N not letting some devices thru the firewall (bumping apple devices to let PCs in, not talking to Smart TV or Wireless appliances, not anymore with my all-purpose Time Capsule.
customer_reviews.author: Designed4use Inc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for when you want to back up your data and look at the internets
customer_reviews.text: I've used a number of backup options for my macs and (years ago) PCs and this is by far the easiest solution. We moved into a new place and I realized that I didn't need a big proper computer desk so I've been working at kitchen tables, dining room tables, couches, beds, and all that. The issue of course is that I'm not able to physically plug in to an external drive for backups like I could when I had a proper computer desk. Not only does this item replace the router we had but it also replaces the external drives. And backs up over wi-fi. Set up was super easy and quick. Works perfectly and handsome as well.
customer_reviews.author: R.Robot

customer_reviews.title: Overheating Issues Just After One Year
customer_reviews.text: I too have overheating issues that started right when the warranty was over. The wifi still works, but it no longer backs up. The noisy fan goes on randomly. I absolutely do not recommend this expensive "hot mess."
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: overheating after one year - don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I loved this for the first year, and now the fan runs loud and high frequently, with "overheating" warnings - even after I've turned if off (unplugged) it overnight. Numerous reports of this online, and now apple has discontinued the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Good for an external back-up drive
customer_reviews.text: I like the Time Capsule and this is my second one. These time capsules back up your data every hour or so which I found was more than what I needed and probably wore my other one out quicker. Now I leave the machine on "off" until I want to do my weekly back-up which is plenty for me. One thing you should know: when one of these time capsules "dies" you can't retrieve the backed up data so you need to have 2 back-up systems :-(
customer_reviews.author: GreenLady

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal, Fast and Easy
customer_reviews.text: The easiest router to set up I've ever worked with. If you own other Apple products, you're off and running after 3-5 clicks after plugging it in. Super fast and strong signal. Time Machine will automatically recognize it on your network - backups are automatic after the initial backup. Perhaps the only con is that the internal hard drive can't be partitioned...not through the setup assistant at least. If you're comfortable creating images, this can be done manually. Partitions are important so that the backups aren't taking up the entire hard drive. I created partitions by uploading images the same size as my computer's hard drive. There are youtube tutorials that will walk you through the process.
customer_reviews.author: Brew4u

customer_reviews.title: Typical Apple product--hook it up and it works!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to extend my With-Fi network because I was having difficulty getting internet on the second floor of our house, so I got the Apple Time Capsule and, as is typical with an Apple product, I plugged in all the cables and instantly had a strong internet Wi-Fi connection where I previously had a weak to non-existent connection before. I did have to tweak the WEP setting of the Wi-Fi router that had been my only Wi-Fi router, but that only took a minute or so and everything was working fine throughout the house. The Time Capsule backup is terrific and the 3TB size provides peace of mind. I highly recommend the Apple Time Capsule.
customer_reviews.author: F. Trumbell

customer_reviews.title: Great when working, but mine went down after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Went on the fritz after less than a year. I started receiving the "double NAT" problem, I replaced my modem and worked with my internet provider before realizing it was the apple time capsule. Apple store replaced it quickly with a new one. When it's up it's great. The device is frustrating when down and with limited accessibility to settings it's nearly impossible to problem solve yourself. Apple Genius bar staff said basically the same thing. It either just works, or it's broken. Too many possible issues to problem solve, so they just replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P Chiang

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected and did not mess up my network
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected and is still working. It arrived with bridge-mode on (i.e., network hub/wi-fi turned off) which is good. Over five ago I bought a much older model which immediately become a hub and fought with my other hub for control of my network devices. Took me a while before I understood what was going on. I bought this one because the other one's hard drive, I think, is getting flaky (having to turn it off and back on to get it to connect).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Backups.. Wifi Network... Seemless setup... Apple!
customer_reviews.text: I bit the bullet and bought this to replace my WD MyCloud and I love it! I was able to setup very fast backups for my multiple home computers and also made this my Wifi network at home. Seemless setup! I would give it 5 stars, but the first one arrived and had a damaged hard drive. Called Apple and was directed to take it to my local Apple Store. Eventhough I bought thru Amazon, they swapped it for a new one - no questions asked! I love a company that stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: PDubATL

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this is hands down the best router for ease of use, features, reliability and performance. It is a shame that Apple has discontinued making their Airport products because there are no other products available that match or even come close to my specific mesh network of wired and wireless access points and router.
customer_reviews.author: jmd

customer_reviews.title: Great Back up Unit
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest back up unit forcApple products. Do not recommend the hourly automatic back up. That only over tax the unit within a two year period, instead just back up in the morning or evening. Tech support from Apple.
customer_reviews.author: World Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Great but slow
customer_reviews.text: As a means to backup your Macs, the Time Capsule is great. Easy to set up. Also it's wifi router works better than the Comcast-supplied one. The only issue I have is with performance. Even when I hook the TC directly to a Mac, file transfers take really long. I tried to copy a 250gb aperture library file to the TC. I stopped it after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: G. Richard Schlueter

customer_reviews.title: Only AC powered, wireless transmission storage available
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, was factory sealed and brand new. Possibly came in sealed Apple shipping box. also. I believed this is, and now was, the only AC powered, wireless transmission storage available. Expensive compared to other systems, but does not have to be plugged in into your computer each time and provides wireless, automated backup of your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Good, modern router with easy mac backups.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Dlink router with this one. I immediately noticed a 50% increase in wireless speed, though that might have been a result of rebooting my cable modem since that's when updates are applied. One thing the included book didn't cover was after restarting the modem, I had to go into the edit section of my airport utility and release/renew my router's DHCP license before I could actually connect to the Internet. It apparently didn't do this upon booting for the first time, or failed if it tried to do so. Everything worked great after that. It works great for backing up the Macs on my network (all 4 of them).
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great for lazy people
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for those who are not tech savvy or too lazy to learn how to back up and do it regularly. It does all the work for you once you set it up. If you have people in your family or business who will inevitably destroy their computer this is nice. Just get a new computer, and restore. Expensive compared to other options, but in the end could be priceless if you want effortless backups and fast net. Do get a high quality surge protector that work on the power and the ethernet cable so you don't waste hundreds though.
customer_reviews.author: laurapin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of THE BEST internet products that I have ever owned. It is fast and works extremely well. I stream both televisions, have my iPad, iPhone and MacBook Pro all operating off of this time capsule. I love it so much I ordered another one for my other property. It also helps that the package was shipped and delivered quickly. When I received the package, it was wrapped very well and was easy to connect. Thank you for quick shipping and a great product. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: K Williams

customer_reviews.title: Computer Back-up Heaven
customer_reviews.text: This is GREAT idea!! I am constantly backed-up right here. I also use off-site back-up, you know in case of pillow fight or earthquake. ONE MUST BE AWARE that this also a modem!!! I was told it was both wifi back-up and modem for internet. IT IS NOT modem, you still need modem. Then ethernet cable Time Capsule to modem. Time Capsule is wifi of course for its wireless back-up purpose and will serve as internet wifi for your house or office with the ethernet cable. Wireless HD back-up - yes, wifi - yes, modem - no.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wakefield

customer_reviews.title: I named it Longrouter and it's great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, never requires a restart, is a performant backup target, and provides ultra high speed wireless networking at significant distances. This replaced the first Airport Extreme with gigabit wired networking for me and is a dramatic performance improvement (of course even more so when using 802.11ac). I ended up having this connected directly to the internal ONT from FIOS via ethernet and it performed excellently in that job. It handled many, many simultaneous connections (I have tons of devices) and always stayed available. My one criticism is that there is a limit to the number of DHCP reservations you can have, and I've hit it. Wish that cap could be lifted.
customer_reviews.author: A. L.

customer_reviews.title: happy
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a year, using to back up 2 macbook airs, and as a router. No complaints. Laptops seems to connect and run time machine with no issues. I am also using an Apple Air Play that is hooked into my inhouse speakers. The Time Capsule and Air Play router seem to play well together with minimal setup issues (just had to connect them in the right order) and once I had it working I haven't had to mess with it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian r

customer_reviews.title: As useless as a Brick
customer_reviews.text: My Airport failed. Suddenly the fan started to run all the time. I got a on screen message that the unit my be overheating. I contacted Apple by phone and found out this is a common problem with Airprt units. The phone tech made an appointment for me at the Apple store at Victoria Gardens in Rancho Cucamonga Ca. Tits on a Bull. They were useless. They told me that they could sell me another one as there is only a 90 day warranty. For what it does its amazing that the warranty is so short. No Faith in their product. I'm going rot price other storage units. At 249.00 thus one Sucks.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Impressive router even for powerusers
customer_reviews.text: Impressive router! I a Cisco E4200 that is supposedly to be a very fast router but Apple had just blown it. I got more than double of speed over wi-fi out of the box vs Cisco with all adjustments... Even with tomato... And I could turn off the repeater that I had in the upper floor... The downside is the Apple way, you have very few options to tweak it and have to use Airport to configure... but for "just works" with this performance I'm more than happy with the trade off!
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Still Working Six Years Later
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in 2014 and it's still working perfectly. I desperately wish Apple were still making these. It may be the very best of many excellent products I've bought from them.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Geusz

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my 2TB with the 3TB
customer_reviews.text: The new design is significantly different than the old flat design. The drive does make a wind up sound when it is being activated after being inactive for a while. It’s not too loud but is noticeable if you are near the device. Setup is fairly simple however it did take a long time to transfer 2GB of data all at one time. If you are copying small files or even single large files its fairly quick but transferring a large number of files will take exponentially longer. I had the 2TB 3rd gen version for over 3 years without any issues. I’m expecting the same great performance out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C

customer_reviews.title: easy setup at  great connection speeds
customer_reviews.text: This unit is an update to my previous Time Capsule. It was very easy to set up with my iMAC. Onscreen instructions prompt you through everything and it was up and running in a few minutes. I do think connection speed are a little faster with this new version but do not have actual data to support this. I also use the Time Machine aspect of this unit to serve as secondary backup (to iCloud) for my MAC. I used Time Warner Cable which is a bigger problem with which to deal (frequent, intermittent loss of network connectivity).
customer_reviews.author: M. Zorbas

customer_reviews.title: Automatic backups anywhere in my home
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup with the AirpotUtility app. From the Mac I set it for backup with Time Machine, at first I connected it via an Ethernet cable because the first backup was going to be several hundred gigabytes, and I left it overnight. After that it makes backups wirelessly about very hour. My ISP provided me a WiFi router, but the Time Capsule's connection is faster. At home we connect wirelessly two Macs, two iPhones, an iPad, and a printer. I've also connected a USB external hard drive to the Time Capsule so that the Macs can access it too.
customer_reviews.author: Sparcus

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a while then overheats
customer_reviews.text: This was fine for about the length of the warranty and then it decided it was overheating. I now get the damn thing cycling the fan on and off constantly. Yes, I've made sure there is no clogging of the fan. I've even drilled extra ventilation in the rear of the case. Bottom line is that if you want backups buy a disk you plug into. This item is not worth it if it takes a dirt nap with your valuable data inaccessible
customer_reviews.author: Calif Martial Artist

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this thing more and more each day! I love having the peace of mind that everything on my MacBook is backed up. Plus the WiFi speeds on this thing are incredible, comparing to the cheap routers my service provider has given me. The other thing is, at first I was wondering how loud the external hard drive would be, but it's actually really silent! I would definitely buy it again if I ever needed another one!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Esparza

customer_reviews.title: Responsible, reliable, ongoing backup - without stress
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Apple Time Capsule. The reason I use it: quickly, reliable, continual backups without needing my attention. When I am home, my computer is getting backed up. Because I have so much data to back up (a terabit), backing up all of my stuff to the cloud is not always easy. Further, some of the content I don't want "in the cloud." This device was quick and easy to set up, and the new wireless bands improved my connectivity and speed around my home. I highly recommend this product if you are an Apple user.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Daniel Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Plugged it in downstairs into the lan outlet
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Plugged it in downstairs into the lan outlet, ran upstairs, full signal in my room, which was amazing considering the one our cable company supplied had a terrible choppy signal in my room - same location, their box was an apparent a.c. box as well Took less than 10 minutes to setup - and bam, everything is paired up to the time capsule extreme Was a little wary about the price, but the simplicity and now blazing internet speed totally makes up for it. My wifi is so fast, I haven't bothered to run a wire to my computer
customer_reviews.author: pj

customer_reviews.title: Faster and broader range
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Airport Extreme with this Time Capsule. The result, I have a much better connection and a large storage device as well. I was getting about 4 Mbps on my laptop in the basement with the Airport Extreme on the 2nd floor of our house (the connection was not always great). Now with the Time Capsule in the same location I am getting 40-60 Mbps in the basement; the Time Capsule has a faster WiFi and broader range. What a great improvement it has been. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: good design, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: like in all apple products, simple, clean design, super easy to set up. it seems to work well. backed up my macbook with 200 gb of memories quickly. i wasn't aware that it won't back up ios devices like iphone, ipad, etc. through wifi. you would have to back up to itunes and it'll back up what's in itunes. would be a great feature later it backs up straight from the devices. i haven't used it long to test its longevity but so far i'm satisfied. can't tell if the internet speed is faster. but didn't seem to be any slower than what i had.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!!!
customer_reviews.text: i've been using time machine to back up my mac to this capsule and just recently bought a new mac, i connected new mac to my network and restored backup to my new baby and BOOOOOOMMM!!! i'm back up and running with ease. setting up this capsule was no problem at all and i used my old airport extreme as a extender for my network outside, i'll say this there is no better router then these and the distance you get for wifi coverage is amazing. i get full signal from behind my shed thats a 150ft from my airport extender.....DON'T THINK JUST BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: PLUMMA

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome function! Been using it for 6 years for all my backups!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great router, not sure I would upgrade unless you internet was fast though.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my prior Gen 4 time machine. It's basically the same, it doesn't have the same firmware version of my prior one, but I imagine that's because it's slightly different with the ability for wireless AC. I upgraded primarily because I got gigabit internet. Plugged in I top out aroun 920 mbps. On wireless I get near 300 mbps on a 2012 Macbook Pro with just a wireless N as the max. All in all, not too bad. I wouldn't say upgrade though unless your internet speeds are very fast though.
customer_reviews.author: thamitch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this Apple Time Capsule and router. Works so good. My wifi is 100MB down. With my laptop I could never get past 55 or 60 on WIFI. This Apple unit - I get almost my full 100 down. 96, 98 consistent with speediest net as the testing site. Looks grey. Works the best of any wireless router I ever owned. Backup is flawless. And setup was a couple of minutes at most Get this Apple product if you need sped. Amazing. Amazing. Get the full sped you pay for from your ISP all via WIFI or ethernet if you choose. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, even with Windows. If gifting to someone who doesn't want to upgrade their Mac OS then read the fine print. The wireless Time Capsule option only works with Mavericks/Yosemite. Have a relative who I'm having issues with even talking them up to Mountain Lion...did not take this into account when buying them this as a gift. Still...it did improve wireless reception in their house and is beautiful/dead simple. Could use a power button though as cycling power requires plugging/unplugging and the connection is tight for older hands. Be awesome if Apple would allow this to be a standalone iTunes library but alas...
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey E Nelson

customer_reviews.title: It an apple!
customer_reviews.text: If you are an apple fan you will love this thing! Like most apple products its very simple to set up out of the box, had it up and running with in several minutes. I like the guest feature, it allows my friends and wifes friends to come over and still use their computers without accessing my personal data. Only thing i would suggest is if you need a USB splitter, buy a self powered unit. I couldn't figure out why my hard drives wouldn't show up and this solved the trick. Also the range on this thing is great, but i am also stepping up from a 2 year old netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Katie J

customer_reviews.title: Great device, potent wireless
customer_reviews.text: Great device, potent wireless. One caveat is that if you experience a power outage, your wifi'll be out while your time capsule does a filesystem check — not so wonderful as I learned recently. As a result of that, I wouldn't use this as your primary wireless device unless you've got it attached to a UPS.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Legible, complete instructions would be nice.
customer_reviews.text: I actually don't know if I like it because I've never gotten one of these working. The "instructions" require a microscope, and they're inadequate. Like all Apple products, things are kept "simple" by including no writing of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: D. Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Work of Art.... Such a joy to use
customer_reviews.text: Such a joy to use this product. The set up was so easy, has excellent signal and looks like a work of art with no crazy antennas sticking out So bummed that Apple decided to stop making this product. My last Time Capsule lasted for 10 years and I hope this will last the same amount of time The wireless backup is such an amazing feature.
customer_reviews.author: Chriswin A Mohan

customer_reviews.title: Get this!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! I bought it for backup purposes BUT the boost in my wifi is incredible! I have 100 speed and get well above that on speed tests! If you are questioning this purchase, DON'T get it!! I get wifi in all rooms of my home and outside by the pool and in the pool house! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Bookreader

customer_reviews.title: Two Necessities in One
customer_reviews.text: The Time Capsule it a combination top level, fastest standard router and a backup drive machine. It's elegant. It's fast. It's automatic. It can't be beat. It is primarily for Mac users, but not exclusively. With a PC, I personally would try something else, but I have learned from experience that not every high rated/high speed router is easy to use/setup/change, etc. Buy with a good return policy. If you're an Apple FanBoy/Girl, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Spafford

customer_reviews.title: the boost is great. I just did the backup tonight and it ...
customer_reviews.text: My wifi went from three echo bands to four, now i get at least three bands evwrywhere in the house while using my iPad. the TIvo DVRs get anywhere from 82 to 100%. the boost is great. I just did the backup tonight and it was easy as pie.. Find TIME Machine in apps, double click, turn on, select the Airport Capsule and backup will begin.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Can be quirky
customer_reviews.text: The router part of the time capsule works real well but the back up is a little bit quirky sometimes I get backed up failed on my monitor Then I restart it and It'll work again. This has happened a few times and I'm not sure why. I haven't tried to restore anything yet so I don't know how that might work.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L.

customer_reviews.title: Very good experience
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any dropped signals since installing this router. Prior to this, I had gone through many top-rated brands, all of which frequently dropped my Comcast signal. I thought the main reason for this was probably because of where the router had to be placed in our home. I was wrong, as this router was placed in the exact same location, but has performed above expectations. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone who is having signal issues.
customer_reviews.author: DoodlesRUs

customer_reviews.title: The Wi-FI is greatly improved and doesn't fall over or heat up like the original
customer_reviews.text: FAR surpasses the original Time capsule. The Wi-FI is greatly improved and doesn't fall over or heat up like the original.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Morton

customer_reviews.title: Check to make sure it is set up for the country you want to use it in
customer_reviews.text: The unit that I had purchased did not have the capabilities to operate in the US. It wasn’t set up with FCC standards. I returned item back.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Apple makes very nice routers. Great wireless signal throughout the house
customer_reviews.text: Apple makes very nice routers. Great wireless signal throughout the house. Wireless AC (if your devices support it). The 2TB time capsule works great for making a backups of all the Mac's in my house as well as acting as a file server for music, movies etc.. for all the devices on my home network.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Now I can actually enjoy them. I had the first generation time capsule ...
customer_reviews.text: I pay for 50Mbps broadband speeds. Now I can actually enjoy them. I had the first generation time capsule and loved it. This one I love even more. If your house is Apple-product centric like mine you will adore this. Best feature was that the speed is no longer throttled by the oldest iPhones in the house. My phone can pull 10Mbps and the MacBooks can still get 50Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wainwright

customer_reviews.title: Solid router, solid automatic continuous backups
customer_reviews.text: Apple's Time Capsule is the first backup solution that is really a solution. It performs continuous delta backups and makes recovery pretty simple. Combining that with network-attached storge (a 3 TB drive with its own network connection without a computer) makes it perfect. On top of that, the WiFi router is as good or better than many other models that are out there. This ia a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett Barouch

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: After converting to Apple after the Windows 8 disaster, I liked the sound of having a router and hard drive/backup device in one unit. The reviews I saw we're all good, so my former router began having issues so I got this around a month ago. I am enjoying all the benefits of appointed back ups for my Mac devices. AC is absolutely great. We dropped cable & this router just continues to provide capacity for a large number of devices. I don't know why I waited so long!
customer_reviews.author: AKVHutch

customer_reviews.title: I replaced my old airport with this quite easily. it definitely reaches farther in my house compared ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old airport with this quite easily. it definitely reaches farther in my house compared to the old version. Setup was quick, and basically was just a matter of switching cables from one to the other. I did use the old airport as an extender after installing the new time capsule, and this was also very easy. ( remember to do the configuration of the airport with it plugged in close to the time capsule first, then once it is configured as an extender, you can plug it in anywhere there is a signal.)
customer_reviews.author: Newshapes

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a new imac. It was having connectivity issues with my current Att uverse wifi in my apt, especially as it was next to a PC that also uses my home wireless network. Figured I would get this time capsule as it would both let me back up using time machine as well as strengthen my network since it uses wifi ac also current with my new imac. I guessed right, it worked like a charm. no more connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.author: Leorl

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: Used this with two other Apple Wifi units to provide complete coverage of my house and barn. Work fantastic with very few problems. Those problems are usually due to the incoming internet and just require a reset of the units every several months. In addition, this one does a time machine backup for my wife with her laptop so she does not have to worry about it. Great units
customer_reviews.author: jdb

customer_reviews.title: Totaly Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing thing I have ever owned! It works fantastic! I've had several high priced routers more expensive than this that claim to be the best...All wireless devices in my house would die out and disconnect from the net if I went on the back porch. This, I can use it anywhere outside and anywhere on my property. As long as you're competent enough to get the app and set up the 5 Ghz network, this is the best buy ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Chevyman

customer_reviews.title: Works seamlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Took over where my old Time Capsule had died. Like shaking hands.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Does so much for your computer system
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to add yet another expensive Apple accessory yet in the end, after lots of research, I determined that this would be the safest, best way to protect my data. I've lost several important drives in the past because they were not automatically baked up. Automatic being the key word. The Apple Time Capsule takes care of the daily details.
customer_reviews.author: Photohombre

customer_reviews.title: Good update
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace an old airport router. There is a big difference in Internet speed with the time capsule
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Daniely

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and very fast
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add to my backup capabilities for my software development business. This was extremely easy to set up-- I connected it to my network, plugged in the power, and ran the Airport utility on my Mac and configured it to join my existing network. I then added it to my Mac's Time Machine backup disks, and backups have been running regularly without a hitch. The faster 802.11ac network works very well with my iPad Air 2. This might not be the cheapest solution out there, but is it extremely easy to use and hassle-free if you are using Macs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: So automatic you don't have to think about backing up anymore
customer_reviews.text: We have several Mac's in our family home. This 3TB unit is large enough to support all of them without problem. There are adequate setup procedures on the Apple web site so I will not go into that here. Suffice it to say that setup was easy. Backups occurred in the background approximately every hour without any noticeable slow-downs in what I was doing on my computer. This backup system is a good decision for all.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stant

customer_reviews.title: Your internet should be faster and not have drop offs after this upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This will be the last router you will have to buy and is worth the high price tag. My Macs and PCs now browse the web without router errors and lag. My apple TV now works correctly and I can fast forward and play movies with out lag. In a nutshell, your cheap router is a bottle neck to your internet. This sets the bar for all routers to preform at. Make the switch to apple products!!!
customer_reviews.author: Me2

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this Time Capsule 2TB with WiFi AC capability. Throughput was great. Be advised, however, do not purchase this if you're looking for a Network Accessible Storage (NAS) type of device. That's not what it's intended for. The internal harddrive spins down constantly, so if you're looking for quick network storage access, this isn't gonna do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur A. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wireless backup!
customer_reviews.text: Apple always represents quality. As soon as I plugged it in my mac found it and started the setup. I had it ready to go in no time and it started my first backup without me even having to blink.
customer_reviews.author: Shane L.

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best, better than all the rest!
customer_reviews.text: This router so far has worked very well, i have not experienced the repeated needed resets that i did with the several Linksys routers that i have used over the years. The only thing that it is lacking is the ability to change the settings and possibly place restrictions and or time limits on it. So far i am very happy with the coverage and the constant signal that it sends to all of my devices.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moragne

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixed networks
customer_reviews.text: I backup up an iMac and Windows PC over wireless and wired networks to this Time Capsule. I also use it as a file and media server for Apple, Windows, and Linux devices. It just works. I wish it had at least one more USB port and another ethernet port too, but within these limitations I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Knauss

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I am running a very basic "I have things that I want connected to the internet reliably" type of connection for my former Macbook Air, current Retina Macbook Pro, iPhone 5S, and PS3, plus a lot of friends' android phones, PC laptops, and my DirecTV network connection. The only thing that this has done is provide a solid, unfaltering, FAST internet connection to everything.
customer_reviews.author: thekingofchina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: As usual, my Apple product worked right out of the box! Hit a homerun with this - hooked up to my network without any hassle; extended my network and my network is running faster than ever. There are NO network breaks, no waiting for streaming videos to load anymore. Excellent product. I'm going to buy at least one more when I move to my new home. Thanks Apple!
customer_reviews.author: Couchsitter1968

customer_reviews.title: Support when you need it.
customer_reviews.text: My older model gave me trouble after seven years so I upgraded. The technical support to identify and correct the problems with the Incoming signal was really excellent.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: It just works.
customer_reviews.text: Had already installed one of these for a friend so when Time Machine ran out of space on a one terabyte WD drive it was a no brainer to get this one for my system. It is now servicing my MacBook Pro, iPhone, iPad, Brother 2270 printer, Sonos Bridge and an AT&T MicroCell. It just works! Now have replaced the cable companies' modem with a Motorola 6141 and the whole works just hums!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff O'Byrne

customer_reviews.title: GGREAT value.  Has worked flawlessly since I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I still use this as my router and NAS device. Has worked flawlessly since I first bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Williams

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended product that works right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a N wireless router and NAS with this a single Apple Time Capsule. Set was so simple and worked immediately. The a/b wireless spreads throughout a large house and automatically integrates with all Apple devices. Highly recommended product that works right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Rationalfears

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!!
customer_reviews.text: I am throwing away all my non-Apple devices. To date I've trashed my laptop (replaced with mac pro), Desktop (replaced with IMac); blackberry (replaced with iPhone). Added several ipads (one for me, wife, daughter-in-law; son). Trashed my linksys wifi for the time capsule. Next on my list is to add an apple tv. This company is as perfect as one can be. The Time Capsule was basically a plug-in and go device. Could not have been simpler. Worked seemlessly with all my wifi devices.
customer_reviews.author: ferrari328

customer_reviews.title: Great device, easy to set-up, a little pricey...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up and reliable. I'm sharing my printer, have back-up storage (manually) and Time Machine storage (automatically), and have a shared WiFi network, if I ever have guests. A bit pricey and only 2 Terabytes (I was hoping for 3-4 TB because I have high expectations), but super easy to set-up and use. You get what you pay for, as they say.
customer_reviews.author: Darin R. Swan

customer_reviews.title: Works great for time machine back ups
customer_reviews.text: Works great for time machine back ups, and all data storage. We not use it as our primary access point router and seems to handle 2 iPhones, iPads, Mac books, 1 Apple TV, Xbox with no slow downs.
customer_reviews.author: Robie

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Easy to set up. Improved our connection to the AppleTV at the other end of the house. We use airport express to extend the range of the Wi-Fi but this is a huge improvement. And we have backed up both of our MacBook Pros successfully. Easy to understand instructions and very intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Larry K.

customer_reviews.title: Best router and storage device. Quick setup.
customer_reviews.text: This was the greatest investment for my home wireless system. The price was the only thing holding me back but now I am glad I bought it. Setup was only 10 - 15 mins and I used my old airport first generation as an extended which was also quick. I have Mac Pro and this setup the backups within mins. The only retreat I should have bought the 3TB because I believe I will have this for the rest of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe and Vi Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of gear!
customer_reviews.text: Quick installation of the Time Capsule, but took quite a bit of effort and research to successfully shut-off the wireless portion and the router aspects of the internet service provider's modem/router (ActionTec C1000A provided by CenturyLink), thereby allowing the Time Capsule to assume the sole role as the home network router. Have 2 wireless networks created, N and 5ghz, so that our variety of wireless devices can be optimized (smart TVs, macbooks, iphones, ipads, Amazon Fire Sticks, and Apple TV). Also, painlessly set-up "guest" access to the network. Great reception throughout the home (2000sf one level). Easy setup of both initially wired and subsequent wireless incremental backups of our computers.
customer_reviews.author: Garland R. Goff

customer_reviews.title: Insurance for peace of mind from disaster
customer_reviews.text: This is peace of mind insurance, I now do not have that worry of what if it all goes away???? Worth the investment. Easy to set up, does all that is said to do, that I like very much.
customer_reviews.author: PJL

customer_reviews.title: A bit confusing
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work fine, but it's a bit confusing. Trying to display the contents of the disc (time machine portion) is very challenging. I guess, it will prove or disprove itself when/if a restore is needed. The Wi Fi is stronger and more stable than the predecessor version for a better connection at a greater distance.
customer_reviews.author: JoeBotts

customer_reviews.title: The product did not work.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my current Airport Time capsule. I was on the phone with Apple support for an hour and the time capsule would not recognize my network. Thus, I had to rush out and buy a completely new router. Not happy. I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Highley

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell it is running backups of two household laptops. The wifi network is working very well at around 113Mbps. The guest network was easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Bravo Golf

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: While the Apple Time Capsule does not provide as many raw features as an equivalent offering from other major vendors, it does deliver the core essentials in a nice, easy-to-use solution. It works great in a predominately Apple environment by providing you with easy Back to the Mac capability and Time Machine backups. One of my favorite features of the Time Capsule is that it does not require a bulky power brick.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mecham

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good about this Apple Time Capsule --its wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about this Apple Time Capsule --its wonderful!! doesn't take up much space, yet looks great on my desk ! Easy hook up was a plus also! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line, incredibly fast and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I have ever purchased. Amazingly fast and it's like it just punches holes through the walls. From one end to the house to the other, it has virtually full signal strength. And the smart TV now never has any signal loss. And with a 3 terabyte back-up, you could not ask for anything better. Pricey but well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Leo D

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to increase range and security of your network
customer_reviews.text: Easiest set up ever. After hook up the program asked if I wanted this tower to replace my Apple Express router. I clicked yes and the program made all the necessary connections to the 7 client machines on my network. Flawless. Only difference is the increase in range and signal strength. And peace of mind for back up of my three Macs.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hatchett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey but I woudn't do without it. Quietly backs up both of my Macs w/o issue.
customer_reviews.author: ShopWisely

customer_reviews.title: incredibly easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Seamless backup from my Mac to the capsule, works well as a wifi device, incredibly easy to set up. I don't think it's supposed to really be for this, but I do use it to transfer files from my Macbook to my husband's Windows machine, to my Android phone and to his iPhone. I set up two wifi networks as well, one for us and one for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Allison F.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install and manage
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install and manage. Easiest solution for my backups. I know other wifi and backup systems may be cheaper, but I chose this because I valued the time savings of just plugging this in and it working. By the way, I called Apple support due to issues with my cable providers router and they were incredibly helpful. Also walked me thru erasing the data on my old time capsule. Good support is worth paying a little more too I think.
customer_reviews.author: E. T. Belton

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I simply use this as an external wireless hard drive for my laptops. I don't have it connected to the internet. The 802.11 AC Wi-Fi is extremely fast with my MacBook air, almost faster or the same as USB, probably faster. I can connect to the hard drive anywhere in my house as long as I'm connected to the Wi-Fi network from the time capsule. When I come back home from a day of shooting I dump all my clips onto the time capsule. 3 TB is plenty for me. And I tend to fill up a 16GB and 32GB card.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Apple Time Capsule 2TB ME177LL/A
customer_reviews.text: Kind of easy to set up but thought my new iMac would make it connect so it could be wireless, but that didn't happen. What's up with that? Had to go through the ethernet connection - roundabout way through the time capsule and then to my computer. It's quiet and is doing the job or so I hope.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Savely

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!  Thank, Amazon!!
customer_reviews.text: Set up was so easy!! Great product for extra need storage space!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Bassir

customer_reviews.title: Great Product although pricey worth it
customer_reviews.text: Although the time capsule is expensive it has been one of my better investments. The signal my apple products receive from the router is much stronger then the router provided by our ISP. The design is elegant and it brings 4 ethernet connections in the back. If you are having any difficulties with your router I would suggest investing in a time capsule.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: easy tio set up
customer_reviews.text: While everything went well with installation, I do have concerns about signal strength whicvh seems less than my older Time Machine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N. Stroh

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The product works as advertised but the cooling fan sounds like a dying animal every time it turns on. Guess you get what you pay for. Also I get an overheating message very frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Givens

customer_reviews.title: Effortless backups and a strong / fast WiFi connection. ...
customer_reviews.text: Effortless backups and a strong / fast WiFi connection. Every apple user with more than one Mac should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good Wireless Router, Lots of Storage
customer_reviews.text: The router is easy to setup, but requires an Apple product (Mac, iPhone, iPad) because it uses an app to setup. So if you've got a PC, this isn't for you. The 3 tb of storage combined with Time Machine (Mac software), makes a disciplined backup automatic. So far, I have not had to recover anything. I should try a practice recovery before it's necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Good back up system
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the way this worked. I had a bit of a difficult time setting it up but that was more my fault for being stubborn and refusing to read the instructions. Dumb I know but I was in a hurry and figured "what the hell?". Going on three months with it and now I cant imagine doing without it. It has saved me more times than I care to admit. Pros: Just works (on mac at least) Looks very nice Takes up very little space in comparison to other back ups Cons: Pricy
customer_reviews.author: Che Boludo

customer_reviews.title: Item exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Item exactly as described. Setup was a breeze on my MBP. Haven't used the back-up feature yet but I will in the future. Replaced my old TP-Link that died. This is definitely a step up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M-MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Backuping Up My Data Is Peace of Mind With The Time Capsule
customer_reviews.text: The Time Capsule is large enough to store a magnatude of files. A burglar stole my computer and I had not backed up my entire hard drive's valuable files. This Time Capsule has given me peace of mind that I now have plenty of space to save my files. It is easy to use and setup so that the backups are automatic. Not only would I recommend this product to everyone but it is a necessity in today's world.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D. Williams

product_meta.title: Apple Time Capsule 2TB ME177LL/A
feature_bullets: Back up a lifetime’s worth of memories with AirPort Time Capsule, a wireless hard drive that works seamlessly with Time Machine in OS X.
It’s also a full-featured Wi-Fi base station with the latest 802.11ac technology and simultaneous dual-band support.
